title: Offenses Against the Person
context: [Part viii.] labor trafficking [ยง707-780] Definitions. As used in this part: &ldquo;Deadly force&rdquo; has the same meaning as in section 703-300. &ldquo;Force&rdquo; has the same meaning as in section 703-300. &ldquo;Labor&rdquo; means work of economic or financial value. Prostitution-related and obscenity-related activities as set forth in chapter 712 are not forms of &ldquo;labor&rdquo; under this part. &ldquo;Services&rdquo; means a relationship between a person and the actor in which the person performs activities under the supervision of or for the benefit of the actor or a third party. Prostitution-related and obscenity-related activities as set forth in chapter 712 are not forms of &ldquo;services&rdquo; under this part. &ldquo;Unlawful force&rdquo; has the same meaning as in section 703-300. &ldquo;Venture&rdquo; means a business relationship between two or more parties to undertake economic activity together. &ldquo;Victim&rdquo; means the person against whom an offense specified in section 707-781 or 707-782 has been committed. [L 2011, c 146, pt of ยง1]
